Description: Shoulder sherd of North Ionian Wild Goat Style pottery oinochoe; exterior, dull cream slip; from top: undetermined motif; broken maeander band between bands with added red bands lined in white; painted decoration consisting of goat (head and antler remaining) to right; three strokes as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.650)
CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (38, pl. 18, 16)
